summary: Project now includes Phase 5D: an order-tracking system for customers via the customer dashboard, with admin-controlled status progression, timestamps, manual location updates, area-specific pickup/drop-off, and admin-authored pop-up notes.
architectural_notes: Order tracking is accessible only via the customer dashboard (no public tracking link).
Real-time GPS is not used; delivery location updates are manually entered by admins.
Pickup/drop-off availability is restricted to the Ashland/Westwood, Kentucky area.
Customers see only the current status and the next status becomes visible only after an admin updates the order.

existing_features.title: Implement a customer-facing order tracking view inside the existing customer Dashboard (dashboard-only access): for each order, show the current tracking status prominently, show the next status as locked/preview until the admin advances the order, and display timestamps for each status change. Also display the latest admin pop-up note(s) and the list of manual location updates (each with timestamp).

Enhance the Admin orders experience so admins can update order tracking from the admin dashboard: provide a per-order detail UI to (a) change the tracking status, (b) add a manual location update, and (c) add a custom pop-up note/message. Ensure the admin UI makes it clear that customers only see progression after admin updates.

new_feature_requests.summary: Phase 5D — Order Tracking: customer-dashboard-only tracking; admin updates statuses (pending/processing/ready for pickup/out for delivery/completed) and customers only see current + next step after admin update; timestamps per status; manual admin-entered location updates (no GPS); pickup/drop-off only for Ashland/Westwood KY area; admin-created custom pop-up notes/messages per order.

Extend the backend order data model to persist order-tracking information per order, including: (a) a tracking status with the allowed values pending, processing, ready for pickup, out for delivery, completed; (b) a status-change history with timestamps for each change; (c) a list of manual admin-entered location updates with timestamps (no GPS); (d) a list of admin-authored pop-up notes/messages with timestamps; and (e) a fulfillment method that can represent delivery vs pickup vs drop-off, with pickup/drop-off intended only for the Ashland/Westwood Kentucky area.

Add backend admin-only methods to manage order tracking: admins can (a) set/update an order’s tracking status; (b) add a manual location update to an order; and (c) add a custom pop-up note/message to an order. Each mutation must append an entry with a timestamp to the appropriate history/log so customers can see when changes happened.

Update backend order read APIs used by the frontend so that the customer order list and admin order list include the tracking data needed for Phase 5D (current status, the computed/derived next status, timestamps/history, location updates, pop-up notes, and fulfillment method). Updates must appear for customers when they refresh (no real-time push).

projectName: Phase 5D — Customer order tracking in Dashboard with admin-controlled status, timestamps, locations, and pop-up notes
